trans-unit.source: Microsoft Azure AD Connect - Upgrade from Windows Azure AD sync tool (DirSync)
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Azure AD Connect - Upgrade from Windows Azure AD sync tool (DirSync)

trans-unit.source: Learn how to upgrade from DirSync to Azure AD Connect.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to upgrade from DirSync to Azure AD Connect.

trans-unit.source: This articles describes the steps for upgrading your current Windows Azure AD sync tool (DirSync) to Azure AD Connect.
trans-unit.target: This articles describes the steps for upgrading your current Windows Azure AD sync tool (DirSync) to Azure AD Connect.

trans-unit.source: Upgrading Windows Azure Active Directory sync (DirSync) to Azure Active Directory Connect
trans-unit.target: Upgrading Windows Azure Active Directory sync (DirSync) to Azure Active Directory Connect

trans-unit.source: The following documentation will help you upgrade your existing DirSync installation to Azure AD Connect
trans-unit.target: The following documentation will help you upgrade your existing DirSync installation to Azure AD Connect

trans-unit.source: Download Azure AD Connect
trans-unit.target: Download Azure AD Connect

trans-unit.source: To get started using Azure AD Connect you can download the latest version using the following: [Download Azure AD Connect](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=615771)
trans-unit.target: To get started using Azure AD Connect you can download the latest version using the following: [Download Azure AD Connect](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=615771)

trans-unit.source: Before you install Azure AD Connect
trans-unit.target: Before you install Azure AD Connect

trans-unit.source: Before you install Azure AD Connect, and upgrade from DirSync here are a few things you will need.
trans-unit.target: Before you install Azure AD Connect, and upgrade from DirSync here are a few things you will need.

trans-unit.source: The password of the existing global administrator account for your Azure AD instance (The install will remind you which account this is)
trans-unit.target: The password of the existing global administrator account for your Azure AD instance (The install will remind you which account this is)

trans-unit.source: An Enterprise Administrator account for your local Active Directory
trans-unit.target: An Enterprise Administrator account for your local Active Directory

trans-unit.source: Optional: If you configured DirSync to use a full version of SQL Server - The information for that database instance.
trans-unit.target: Optional: If you configured DirSync to use a full version of SQL Server - The information for that database instance.

trans-unit.source: Parallel deployment
trans-unit.target: Parallel deployment

trans-unit.source: If you are currently synchronizing more than 50K objects then you will be given an option to perform a parallel deployment.
trans-unit.target: If you are currently synchronizing more than 50K objects then you will be given an option to perform a parallel deployment.

trans-unit.source: Parallel deployment requires a separate server or set of servers (if you require a separate server for SQL Server).
trans-unit.target: Parallel deployment requires a separate server or set of servers (if you require a separate server for SQL Server).

trans-unit.source: The benefit of parallel deployment is the opportunity to avoid synchronization downtime.
trans-unit.target: The benefit of parallel deployment is the opportunity to avoid synchronization downtime.

trans-unit.source: The Azure AD Connect installation will attempt to estimate the downtime that we expect, but if you've upgraded DirSync in the past your own experience is likely to be the best guide.
trans-unit.target: The Azure AD Connect installation will attempt to estimate the downtime that we expect, but if you've upgraded DirSync in the past your own experience is likely to be the best guide.

trans-unit.source: Installing Azure AD Connect
trans-unit.target: Installing Azure AD Connect

trans-unit.source: Download Azure AD Connect and copy to your existing DirSync server.
trans-unit.target: Download Azure AD Connect and copy to your existing DirSync server.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to and double-click on AzureADConnect.msi
trans-unit.target: Navigate to and double-click on AzureADConnect.msi

trans-unit.source: Begin stepping through the wizard
trans-unit.target: Begin stepping through the wizard

trans-unit.source: For in-place upgrade the following high level steps occur:
trans-unit.target: For in-place upgrade the following high level steps occur:

trans-unit.source: Welcome to Azure AD Connect
trans-unit.target: Welcome to Azure AD Connect

trans-unit.source: Analysis of current DirSync Configuration
trans-unit.target: Analysis of current DirSync Configuration

trans-unit.source: Collect Azure AD global admin password
trans-unit.target: Collect Azure AD global admin password

trans-unit.source: Collect credentials for an enterprise admin account (only used during the installation of Azure AD Connect)
trans-unit.target: Collect credentials for an enterprise admin account (only used during the installation of Azure AD Connect)

trans-unit.source: Installation of AAD Connect
trans-unit.target: Installation of AAD Connect

trans-unit.source: Unintall DirSync
trans-unit.target: Unintall DirSync

trans-unit.source: Install AAD Connect
trans-unit.target: Install AAD Connect

trans-unit.source: Optionally begin Synchronization
trans-unit.target: Optionally begin Synchronization

trans-unit.source: Additional steps/information is required when:
trans-unit.target: Additional steps/information is required when:

trans-unit.source: You're currently using Full SQL Server - Local or Remote
trans-unit.target: You're currently using Full SQL Server - Local or Remote

trans-unit.source: You have more than 50K objects in scope for synchronization
trans-unit.target: You have more than 50K objects in scope for synchronization

trans-unit.source: In-place upgrade - less than 50K objects - SQL Express (Walkthrough)
trans-unit.target: In-place upgrade - less than 50K objects - SQL Express (Walkthrough)

trans-unit.source: Launch the Azure AD Connect Installer (MSI)
trans-unit.target: Launch the Azure AD Connect Installer (MSI)

trans-unit.source: Review and agree to license terms and privacy notice.
trans-unit.target: Review and agree to license terms and privacy notice.

trans-unit.source: Welcome to Azure AD
trans-unit.target: Welcome to Azure AD

trans-unit.source: Click next to be analysis of your existing DirSync installation
trans-unit.target: Click next to be analysis of your existing DirSync installation

trans-unit.source: Analyzing existing Directory Sync installation
trans-unit.target: Analyzing existing Directory Sync installation

trans-unit.source: When the analysis completes we will make recommendations on how to proceed.
trans-unit.target: When the analysis completes we will make recommendations on how to proceed.

trans-unit.source: In this scenario (less than 50K objects using SQL Express) the following screen is displayed.
trans-unit.target: In this scenario (less than 50K objects using SQL Express) the following screen is displayed.

trans-unit.source: Analysis completed ready to upgrade from DirSync
trans-unit.target: Analysis completed ready to upgrade from DirSync

trans-unit.source: Provide the password for the account you currently use to connect to Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: Provide the password for the account you currently use to connect to Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: Enter your Azure AD credentials
trans-unit.target: Enter your Azure AD credentials

trans-unit.source: Provide an enterprise admin account for Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: Provide an enterprise admin account for Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: Enter your Azure AD credentials
trans-unit.target: Enter your Azure AD credentials

trans-unit.source: You're now ready to configure.
trans-unit.target: You're now ready to configure.

trans-unit.source: When you clieck next DirSync will be uninstalled and Azure AD Connect will be configured and begin synchronizing.
trans-unit.target: When you clieck next DirSync will be uninstalled and Azure AD Connect will be configured and begin synchronizing.

trans-unit.source: Enter your Azure AD credentials
trans-unit.target: Enter your Azure AD credentials

trans-unit.source: In-place upgrade - more than 50K objects
trans-unit.target: In-place upgrade - more than 50K objects

trans-unit.source: At step #3 you will see a different message if you have more than 50K objects in scope for synchronization.
trans-unit.target: At step #3 you will see a different message if you have more than 50K objects in scope for synchronization.

trans-unit.source: A screen similar to the following will be displayed:
trans-unit.target: A screen similar to the following will be displayed:

trans-unit.source: Enter your Azure AD credentials
trans-unit.target: Enter your Azure AD credentials

trans-unit.source: In this case we recommend you consider a parallel upgrade on a separate server.
trans-unit.target: In this case we recommend you consider a parallel upgrade on a separate server.

trans-unit.source: Our reason for this recommendation is that depending on the size of your organization an in-place upgrade may impact your service level agreements with your business regarding how quickly changes in local Active Directory are reflected in Azure AD / Office 365.
trans-unit.target: Our reason for this recommendation is that depending on the size of your organization an in-place upgrade may impact your service level agreements with your business regarding how quickly changes in local Active Directory are reflected in Azure AD / Office 365.

trans-unit.source: We attempt to estimate how long it may take for the first synchronization using Azure AD Connect.
trans-unit.target: We attempt to estimate how long it may take for the first synchronization using Azure AD Connect.

trans-unit.source: As mentioned above, your own experience with the original installation of DirSync or upgrades to DirSync are likely to be the best indicator.
trans-unit.target: As mentioned above, your own experience with the original installation of DirSync or upgrades to DirSync are likely to be the best indicator.

trans-unit.source: Parallel deployment requires a separate server or servers (if you are required to run SQL Server on a separate server from Azure AD Connect).
trans-unit.target: Parallel deployment requires a separate server or servers (if you are required to run SQL Server on a separate server from Azure AD Connect).

trans-unit.source: For that reason it's completely reasonable to consider an in-place upgrade if it can be scheduled in way to avoid impacts within your organization.
trans-unit.target: For that reason it's completely reasonable to consider an in-place upgrade if it can be scheduled in way to avoid impacts within your organization.

trans-unit.source: To proceed with an in-place upgrade click the checkbox next to the message: "Continue upgrading DirSync on this computer".
trans-unit.target: To proceed with an in-place upgrade click the checkbox next to the message: "Continue upgrading DirSync on this computer".

trans-unit.source: In-place upgrade - Full SQL Server
trans-unit.target: In-place upgrade - Full SQL Server

trans-unit.source: At step #3 you will see a different message if your DirSync installation is using a local or remote full version of SQL Server.
trans-unit.target: At step #3 you will see a different message if your DirSync installation is using a local or remote full version of SQL Server.

trans-unit.source: A screen similar to the following will be displayed:
trans-unit.target: A screen similar to the following will be displayed:

trans-unit.source: Enter your Azure AD credentials
trans-unit.target: Enter your Azure AD credentials

trans-unit.source: The information regarding the existing SQL Server database server being used by DirSync is displayed to you.
trans-unit.target: The information regarding the existing SQL Server database server being used by DirSync is displayed to you.

trans-unit.source: If need be make the appropriate adjustments.
trans-unit.target: If need be make the appropriate adjustments.

trans-unit.source: Clicking "Next" will continue the installation.
trans-unit.target: Clicking "Next" will continue the installation.

trans-unit.source: Parallel deployment - more than 50K objects
trans-unit.target: Parallel deployment - more than 50K objects

trans-unit.source: At step #3 if you have more than 50K objects the Azure AD Connect installation will recommend a parallel deployment.
trans-unit.target: At step #3 if you have more than 50K objects the Azure AD Connect installation will recommend a parallel deployment.

trans-unit.source: See "In-place upgrade - more than 50K objects" above for information on whether to choose in-place or pallell deployment of Azure AD Connect.
trans-unit.target: See "In-place upgrade - more than 50K objects" above for information on whether to choose in-place or pallell deployment of Azure AD Connect.

trans-unit.source: A screen similar to the following will be displayed:
trans-unit.target: A screen similar to the following will be displayed:

trans-unit.source: Enter your Azure AD credentials
trans-unit.target: Enter your Azure AD credentials

trans-unit.source: If you want to proceed with parallel deployment you will need to perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: If you want to proceed with parallel deployment you will need to perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Click the "Export settings" button.
trans-unit.target: Click the "Export settings" button.

trans-unit.source: When you install Azure AD Connect on a separate server these settings will be imported to migrate any settings from your Current DirSync to your new AAD Connect installation.
trans-unit.target: When you install Azure AD Connect on a separate server these settings will be imported to migrate any settings from your Current DirSync to your new AAD Connect installation.

trans-unit.source: Once your settings have beens successfully exported you can exit the Azure AD Connect wizard on the DirSync server.
trans-unit.target: Once your settings have beens successfully exported you can exit the Azure AD Connect wizard on the DirSync server.

trans-unit.source: Installation of Azure AD Connect on separate server
trans-unit.target: Installation of Azure AD Connect on separate server

trans-unit.source: When you install Azure AD Connect on a new server it won't find DirSync and will assume that you want to perform a clean install of Azure AD Connect.
trans-unit.target: When you install Azure AD Connect on a new server it won't find DirSync and will assume that you want to perform a clean install of Azure AD Connect.

trans-unit.source: There are a couple of special steps here:
trans-unit.target: There are a couple of special steps here:

trans-unit.source: Run the Azure AD Connect installer (MSI)
trans-unit.target: Run the Azure AD Connect installer (MSI)

trans-unit.source: When you see the "Welecome to Azure AD Connect" screen.
trans-unit.target: When you see the "Welecome to Azure AD Connect" screen.

trans-unit.source: Exit the wizard by clicking the "X" in the top right corner of the windows.
trans-unit.target: Exit the wizard by clicking the "X" in the top right corner of the windows.

trans-unit.source: Open a command prompt
trans-unit.target: Open a command prompt

trans-unit.source: From the install location of Azure AD Connect (Default: C:\Program Files\Microsoft Azure Active Directory Connect) execute the following command:
trans-unit.target: From the install location of Azure AD Connect (Default: C:\Program Files\Microsoft Azure Active Directory Connect) execute the following command:

trans-unit.source: AzureADConnect.exe /migrate
trans-unit.target: AzureADConnect.exe /migrate

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connects and presents you with the following UI:
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connects and presents you with the following UI:

trans-unit.source: Enter your Azure AD credentials
trans-unit.target: Enter your Azure AD credentials

trans-unit.source: Select the settings file that exported from your DirSync installation.
trans-unit.target: Select the settings file that exported from your DirSync installation.

trans-unit.source: Configure any advanced options including:
trans-unit.target: Configure any advanced options including:

trans-unit.source: A custom installation location for Azure AD Connect
trans-unit.target: A custom installation location for Azure AD Connect

trans-unit.source: An existing instance of SQL Server (Default: Azure AD Connect installs SQL Server 2012 Express)
trans-unit.target: An existing instance of SQL Server (Default: Azure AD Connect installs SQL Server 2012 Express)

trans-unit.source: A service account used to connect to SQL Server (If your SQL Server database is remote then this account must be a domain service account)
trans-unit.target: A service account used to connect to SQL Server (If your SQL Server database is remote then this account must be a domain service account)

trans-unit.source: See those options in the following UI:
trans-unit.target: See those options in the following UI:

trans-unit.source: Enter your Azure AD credentials
trans-unit.target: Enter your Azure AD credentials

trans-unit.source: Click Next.
trans-unit.target: Click Next.

trans-unit.source: On the "Ready to configure" page leave the "Start the synchronization process as soon as the configuration completes" checked.
trans-unit.target: On the "Ready to configure" page leave the "Start the synchronization process as soon as the configuration completes" checked.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Synchronization between Windows Server Active Directory and Azure Active Directory will begin, but no changes will be exported to Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Synchronization between Windows Server Active Directory and Azure Active Directory will begin, but no changes will be exported to Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: Only one synchronization tool can be actively exporting changes at a time.
trans-unit.target: Only one synchronization tool can be actively exporting changes at a time.

trans-unit.source: Click "Install".
trans-unit.target: Click "Install".

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] We uncheck the start synchronization checkbox in order to ensure that DirSync, which is still installed and running and Azure AD Connect do not attempt to write to AAD at the same time.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] We uncheck the start synchronization checkbox in order to ensure that DirSync, which is still installed and running and Azure AD Connect do not attempt to write to AAD at the same time.

trans-unit.source: Check that Azure AD Connect is ready to begin sychronization
trans-unit.target: Check that Azure AD Connect is ready to begin sychronization

trans-unit.source: In order to determine whether or not Azure AD Connect is ready to takeover from DirSync you'll need to open the Azure AD Connect Synchronization Service Manager.
trans-unit.target: In order to determine whether or not Azure AD Connect is ready to takeover from DirSync you'll need to open the Azure AD Connect Synchronization Service Manager.

trans-unit.source: Searching using "Synchronization" at the Start menu of Windows will reveal this application.
trans-unit.target: Searching using "Synchronization" at the Start menu of Windows will reveal this application.

trans-unit.source: Within the application you will will need to view the "Operations" tab.
trans-unit.target: Within the application you will will need to view the "Operations" tab.

trans-unit.source: On this tab you are looking to confirm that the following operations have been completed:
trans-unit.target: On this tab you are looking to confirm that the following operations have been completed:

trans-unit.source: Import on the AD Management Agent
trans-unit.target: Import on the AD Management Agent

trans-unit.source: Import on the Azure AD Management Agent
trans-unit.target: Import on the Azure AD Management Agent

trans-unit.source: Full Sync on the AD Management Agent
trans-unit.target: Full Sync on the AD Management Agent

trans-unit.source: Full Sync on the Azure AD Management Agent
trans-unit.target: Full Sync on the Azure AD Management Agent

trans-unit.source: Once these 4 operations have been completed you're ready to uninstall DirSync and enable Azure AD Connect Synchronization.
trans-unit.target: Once these 4 operations have been completed you're ready to uninstall DirSync and enable Azure AD Connect Synchronization.

trans-unit.source: Uninstall DirSync (old Server)
trans-unit.target: Uninstall DirSync (old Server)

trans-unit.source: From within "Add or remove programs" locate "Windows Azure Active Directory sync tool"
trans-unit.target: From within "Add or remove programs" locate "Windows Azure Active Directory sync tool"

trans-unit.source: Uninstall "Windows Azure Active Directory sync tool"
trans-unit.target: Uninstall "Windows Azure Active Directory sync tool"

trans-unit.source: Open Azure AD Connect (new Server)
trans-unit.target: Open Azure AD Connect (new Server)

trans-unit.source: After installation re-opening Azure AD connect will provide you with a configuration experience.
trans-unit.target: After installation re-opening Azure AD connect will provide you with a configuration experience.

trans-unit.source: Open Azure AD Connect.
trans-unit.target: Open Azure AD Connect.

trans-unit.source: You should see the following:
trans-unit.target: You should see the following:

trans-unit.source: Enter your Azure AD credentials
trans-unit.target: Enter your Azure AD credentials

trans-unit.source: Select "Configure staging mode"
trans-unit.target: Select "Configure staging mode"

trans-unit.source: Upgrading from DirSync using exported settings automatically puts Azure AD Connect in staging mode.
trans-unit.target: Upgrading from DirSync using exported settings automatically puts Azure AD Connect in staging mode.

trans-unit.source: Staging mode basically means that Synchronization will occur within Azure AD connect, but changes will not be exported to Azure AD or AD.
trans-unit.target: Staging mode basically means that Synchronization will occur within Azure AD connect, but changes will not be exported to Azure AD or AD.

trans-unit.source: Turn off staging by unchecking the "Enabled staging mode" checkbox.
trans-unit.target: Turn off staging by unchecking the "Enabled staging mode" checkbox.

trans-unit.source: Enter your Azure AD credentials
trans-unit.target: Enter your Azure AD credentials

trans-unit.source: Click the install button
trans-unit.target: Click the install button

trans-unit.source: Congratulations you've successfully migrated to Azure AD Connect using Parallel deployment.
trans-unit.target: Congratulations you've successfully migrated to Azure AD Connect using Parallel deployment.

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect supporting components
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect supporting components

trans-unit.source: The following is a list of per-requisites and supporting components that Azure AD Connect will install on the server that you set Azure AD Connect up on.
trans-unit.target: The following is a list of per-requisites and supporting components that Azure AD Connect will install on the server that you set Azure AD Connect up on.

trans-unit.source: This list is for a basic Express installation.
trans-unit.target: This list is for a basic Express installation.

trans-unit.source: If you choose to use a different SQL Server on the Install synchronization services page then, the SQL Server 2012 components listed below are not installed.
trans-unit.target: If you choose to use a different SQL Server on the Install synchronization services page then, the SQL Server 2012 components listed below are not installed.

trans-unit.source: Forefront Identity Manager Azure Active Directory Connector
trans-unit.target: Forefront Identity Manager Azure Active Directory Connector

trans-unit.source: Microsoft SQL Server 2012 Command Line Utilities
trans-unit.target: Microsoft SQL Server 2012 Command Line Utilities

trans-unit.source: Microsoft SQL Server 2012 Native Client
trans-unit.target: Microsoft SQL Server 2012 Native Client

trans-unit.source: Microsoft SQL Server 2012 Express LocalDB
trans-unit.target: Microsoft SQL Server 2012 Express LocalDB

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory Module for Windows PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory Module for Windows PowerShell

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Online Services Sign-In Assistant for IT Professionals
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Online Services Sign-In Assistant for IT Professionals

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Visual C++ 2013 Redistribution Package
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Visual C++ 2013 Redistribution Package

trans-unit.source: Additional Resources
trans-unit.target: Additional Resources

trans-unit.source: Use your on-premises identity infrastructure in the cloud
trans-unit.target: Use your on-premises identity infrastructure in the cloud

trans-unit.source: How Azure AD Connect works
trans-unit.target: How Azure AD Connect works

trans-unit.source: Whats Next with Azure AD Connect
trans-unit.target: Whats Next with Azure AD Connect

trans-unit.source: Learn More
trans-unit.target: Learn More

trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect on MSDN

trans-unit.target: test
